type.name: org.gradle.api.plugins.quality.FindBugs
type.description: Analyzes code with FindBugs. See the FindBugs Manual for additional information on configuration options.

method.name: getClasses
method.description: The classes to be analyzed.

method.name: getClasspath
method.description: Compile class path for the classes to be analyzed. The classes on this class path are used during analysis but aren't analyzed themselves.

method.name: getEffort
method.description: The analysis effort level. The value specified should be one of min, default, or max. Higher levels increase precision and find more bugs at the expense of running time and memory consumption.

method.name: getExcludeBugsFilter
method.description: The filename of a filter specifying baseline bugs to exclude from being reported.

method.name: getExcludeBugsFilterConfig
method.description: A filter specifying baseline bugs to exclude from being reported.

method.name: getExcludeFilter
method.description: The filename of a filter specifying bugs to exclude from being reported.

method.name: getExcludeFilterConfig
method.description: A filter specifying bugs to exclude from being reported. Replaces the excludeFilter property. @since 2.2

method.name: getExtraArgs
method.description:
Any additional arguments (not covered here more explicitly like effort) to be passed along to FindBugs.

Extra arguments are passed to FindBugs after the arguments Gradle understands (like effort but before the list of classes to analyze. This should only be used for arguments that cannot be provided by Gradle directly. Gradle does not try to interpret or validate the arguments before passing them to FindBugs.

See the FindBugs TextUICommandLine source for available options. @since 2.6

method.name: getFindbugsClasspath
method.description: Class path holding the FindBugs library.

method.name: getIgnoreFailures
method.description: Whether or not to allow the build to continue if there are warnings.

method.name: getIncludeFilter
method.description: The filename of a filter specifying which bugs are reported.

method.name: getIncludeFilterConfig
method.description: A filter specifying which bugs are reported. Replaces the includeFilter property. @since 2.2

method.name: getMaxHeapSize
method.description: The maximum heap size for the forked findbugs process (ex: '1g').

method.name: getOmitVisitors
method.description: Similar to visitors except that it specifies bug detectors which should not be run. By default, no visitors are omitted.

method.name: getPluginClasspath
method.description: Class path holding any additional FindBugs plugins.

method.name: getReportLevel
method.description: The priority threshold for reporting bugs. If set to low, all bugs are reported. If set to medium (the default), medium and high priority bugs are reported. If set to high, only high priority bugs are reported.

method.name: getReports
method.description:
The reports to be generated by this task.

returns:The reports container

method.name: getVisitors
method.description: The bug detectors which should be run. The bug detectors are specified by their class names, without any package qualification. By default, all detectors which are not disabled by default are run.

method.name: reports
reports
setExcludeBugsFilter
method.description: The filename of a filter specifying baseline bugs to exclude from being reported.

method.name: setExcludeFilter
method.description: The filename of a filter specifying bugs to exclude from being reported.

method.name: setIncludeFilter
method.description: The filename of a filter specifying which bugs are reported.

property.name: classpath
property.description: Compile class path for the classes to be analyzed. The classes on this class path are used during analysis but aren't analyzed themselves.

property.name: effort
property.description: The analysis effort level. The value specified should be one of min, default, or max. Higher levels increase precision and find more bugs at the expense of running time and memory consumption.

property.name: excludeBugsFilter
property.description: The filename of a filter specifying baseline bugs to exclude from being reported.

property.name: excludeBugsFilterConfig
property.description: A filter specifying baseline bugs to exclude from being reported.

property.name: excludeFilter
property.description: The filename of a filter specifying bugs to exclude from being reported.

property.name: excludeFilterConfig
property.description: A filter specifying bugs to exclude from being reported. Replaces the excludeFilter property. @since 2.2

property.name: extraArgs
property.description:
Any additional arguments (not covered here more explicitly like effort) to be passed along to FindBugs.

Extra arguments are passed to FindBugs after the arguments Gradle understands (like effort but before the list of classes to analyze. This should only be used for arguments that cannot be provided by Gradle directly. Gradle does not try to interpret or validate the arguments before passing them to FindBugs.

See the FindBugs TextUICommandLine source for available options. @since 2.6

property.name: findbugsClasspath
property.description: Class path holding the FindBugs library.

property.name: ignoreFailures
property.description: Whether or not to allow the build to continue if there are warnings.

property.name: includeFilter
property.description: The filename of a filter specifying which bugs are reported.

property.name: includeFilterConfig
property.description: A filter specifying which bugs are reported. Replaces the includeFilter property. @since 2.2

property.name: maxHeapSize
property.description: The maximum heap size for the forked findbugs process (ex: '1g').

property.name: omitVisitors
property.description: Similar to visitors except that it specifies bug detectors which should not be run. By default, no visitors are omitted.

property.name: pluginClasspath
property.description: Class path holding any additional FindBugs plugins.

property.name: reportLevel
property.description: The priority threshold for reporting bugs. If set to low, all bugs are reported. If set to medium (the default), medium and high priority bugs are reported. If set to high, only high priority bugs are reported.

property.name: reports
property.description:
The reports to be generated by this task.

returns:The reports container

property.name: visitors
property.description: The bug detectors which should be run. The bug detectors are specified by their class names, without any package qualification. By default, all detectors which are not disabled by default are run.
